title: Bitcoin, Bed Bath & Beyond, Walgreens, Exxon: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; Bitcoin is extending its decline; Energy companies are gaining premarket on higher crude prices
text:
* Bitcoin is extending its slump, but crypto stocks aren't being uniformly dragged down with it. Bitcoin miners Marathon Digital fell 1.4% premarket and Hut 8 Mining slid 3.1%, but bitcoin wallet provider Coinbase added 0.9% and Bakkt Holdings gained 1.9%. In a crypto rout, perhaps its better to make your money trading the stuff than spending money on digging it up.

* Datadog shares added 2.1% ahead of the bell on an otherwise bad day for tech shares, albeit in low-volume trading. The cloud security company said it had entered a partnership with Amazon Web Services on product development.

* Akamai Technologies shares dropped 2.1% premarket after Piper Sandler cut its rating on the stock and lowered its price target.

* Flagship meme stocks AMC Entertainment and GameStop are finding their footing, with premarket rises of 0.8% and 1.8%, after suffering particularly badly during Wednesday's broad market drop.

* Crude prices are climbing, and energy companies are along for the ride. Chevron rose 1.2%, Exxon Mobil climbed 1.4%, Occidental Petroleum added 1.9% and Baker Hughes gained 1.6%.

Chart of the Day

* Investors are betting that rising interest rates and a tech swoon could bring American stocks' winning streak to an end in 2022.

Write to James Willhite at james.willhite@wsj.com

Bitcoin, Bed Bath & Beyond, Walgreens, Exxon: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
